note: It was a commonplace that children ought not to die before their parents (e.g.
title: The poor might hope that children would support them in their old age, the rich that their sons would perpetuate their name, wealth and distinction
Nevertheless, statesmen often perceived upper-class men as reluctant to do their patriotic duty. Augustus attempted to encourage marriage and reproduction through legislation
198–202), but there was a high risk that they would, and ancient literature contains pathetic testimony
Children also ran the risk of being orphaned: Roman lawyers were concerned with guardianship for those who lost a father before puberty
Eventually, emperors took measures to support some children
Rejection of a child or of a parent, for instance ignoring either in one’s will, was a serious step

note: The consensus is that it was, vague though Latin is on age (Dixon 1992: 98–132; Harlow and Laurence 2002). Vergil observed the socialization of babies:
title: Children were normally the preferred heirs
Violence to parents was a sin, parallel to sacrilege or treason (Cic. Sex
4.19, 38, 46). Ideally, violent punishment of children was avoided
Pietas to blood-kin is a theme in all kinds of text
Scholars have asked whether childhood was seen as a separate stage of life
